001package Calibration_Demos_More;
002
003import java.awt.Color;
004
005import ij.IJ;
006import ij.ImagePlus;
007import ij.ImageStack;
008import ij.io.LogStream;
009import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
010import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
011import imagingbook.calibration.data.zhang.CalibrationImage;
012import imagingbook.calibration.data.zhang.ZhangData;
013import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.Camera;
014import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.ViewTransform;
015import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
016import imagingbook.core.resource.ImageResource;
017
018
019/**
020 * This plugin draws the projected X/Y/Z coordinate axes
021 * for each of the given camera views.
022 * 
023 * @author W. Burger
024 * @version 2021-08-22
025 */
026public class Demo_Draw_3D_Axes implements PlugIn {
027        
028        private static ImageResource resource = CalibrationImage.CalibImageStack;       // = "CalibImageStack.tif"
029
030        static Color BackGroundColor = Color.white;
031        static Color LineColor = Color.magenta;
032        static Color xColor = Color.red;
033        static Color yColor = Color.green;
034        static Color zColor = Color.blue;
035
036        static double axisLength = 5;   
037        static boolean BeVerbose = false;
038
039        static {
040                LogStream.redirectSystem();
041                PrintPrecision.set(6);
042        }
043
044        public void run(String arg0) {
045                // create a 3D model:
046
047                double[] p0 = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0}; // 3D origin
048                double[] p1 = {axisLength, 0.0, 0.0};
049                double[] p2 = {0.0, axisLength, 0.0};
050                double[] p3 = {0.0, 0.0, axisLength};
051
052                // open the test image (stack):
053                ImagePlus testIm = resource.getImagePlus();
054                if (testIm == null) {
055                        IJ.error("Could not open calibration images!");
056                        return;
057                }
058                testIm.show();
059
060                // get the camera intrinsics (typically by calibration):
061                Camera camera = ZhangData.getCameraIntrinsics();
062
063                // get all view parameters (extrinsics):
064                ViewTransform[] views = ZhangData.getAllViewTransforms();
065                int M = views.length;
066
067                // project and draw the model into the views:
068                ImageStack stack = testIm.getStack();
069                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
070                        ImageProcessor ip = stack.getProcessor(i + 1);
071                        ip.setColor(xColor);
072                        drawProjectedSegment(ip, camera, views[i], p0, p1);
073                        ip.setColor(yColor);
074                        drawProjectedSegment(ip, camera, views[i], p0, p2);
075                        ip.setColor(zColor);
076                        drawProjectedSegment(ip, camera, views[i], p0, p3);
077                }
078                testIm.updateAndDraw();
079        }
080
081        private void drawProjectedSegment(ImageProcessor ip, Camera cam, ViewTransform V, double[] P1, double[] P2) {
082                double[] u1 = cam.project(V, P1);
083                int u1x = (int) Math.round(u1[0]);
084                int u1y = (int) Math.round(u1[1]);
085                double[] u2 = cam.project(V, P2);
086                int u2x = (int) Math.round(u2[0]);
087                int u2y = (int) Math.round(u2[1]);
088                ip.drawLine(u1x, u1y, u2x, u2y);
089        }
090
091
092}
